æˆ‘æœ€å¼€å§‹æƒ³åˆ°äº†é€šè¿‡å®ç° ConstraintValidator çš„æ–¹å¼æ¥å®ç°æˆ‘çš„éœ€æ±‚ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ä½¿ç”¨è¿™ä¸ªæ–¹æ³•è™½ç„¶å¯ä»¥å®ç°ä¿è¯å­—æ®µä¸ä¸º Null ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ä¸å¯ä»¥å®ç°æ ¹æ®ä¸åŒçš„å¤„ç†å™¨æ¥åˆ¤æ–­è¿‡æ»¤é€»è¾‘è¦ä¸è¦æ‰§è¡Œï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥è¿™ä¸ªå®ç°æ–¹æ¡ˆå°± pass äº†

@Constraint(validatedBy = NotNullAspect.class)
@Target(ElementType.FIELD)
@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
public @interface NotNull {

  String message() default "è¯¥å­—æ®µä¸èƒ½ä¸ºç©º";
  Class<?>[] groups() default {};
  Class<? extends Payload>[] payload() default {};

}


@Aspect
@Component
@NoArgsConstructor
public class NotNullAspect implements ConstraintValidator<NotNull, Object> {

  @Override
  public boolean isValid(Object value, ConstraintValidatorContext context) {
    if(value == null){
      return false;
    }
    if(value instanceof String){
      return !((String) value).isEmpty();
    }
    return true;
    
    // ç”±äºæ²¡æœ‰å®ç°æ ¹æ®ä¸åŒçš„å¤„ç†å™¨ç±»æ¥åˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯å¦è¿›è¡Œè¿‡æ»¤æ“ä½œçš„æ–¹æ¡ˆï¼Œå› æ­¤è¯¥æ–¹æ³•å¼ƒç”¨
  }
}

ç„¶åæˆ‘æƒ³åˆ°ä½¿ç”¨æ³¨è§£+AOP çš„æ–¹å¼æ¥å®ç°æˆ‘çš„éœ€æ±‚ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ AOP æå–ä»£ç å¥½åƒåˆä»…ä»…é€‚ç”¨äºæ³¨è§£ç”¨äºä¿®é¥°æ–¹æ³•çš„æƒ…å†µï¼Œæˆ‘ç”¨æ³¨è§£ä¿®é¥°å±æ€§å¹¶ä¸”å†™å…¥å¯¹åº”çš„å¤„ç†é€»è¾‘å¾—åˆ°çš„ç»“æœæ˜¯æ ¹æœ¬å°±ä¸æ‰§è¡Œæˆ‘çš„ä»£ç 

@Target(ElementType.FIELD)
@Retention(RUNTIME)
public @interface NotNull {

  Class<?>[] groups() default {};

}

@Aspect
@Component
@NoArgsConstructor
public class NotNullAspect {

  @Pointcut("@annotation(com.org.example.verification.NotNull) && execution(* org.example..*(..))")
  public void fieldNotNullPointCut() {

  }

  @Before("fieldNotNullPointCut()")
  public void before(JoinPoint joinPoint) throws Exception {
    Object target = joinPoint.getTarget();
    Class<?> targetClass = target.getClass();
    String className = joinPoint.getTarget().getClass().getName();
    Class<?> processorClass = Class.forName(className);
    for (Field field : targetClass.getDeclaredFields()) {
      NotNull annotation = field.getAnnotation(NotNull.class);
      if (annotation != null) {
        for (Class<?> procClass : annotation.message()) {
          if (procClass.equals(processorClass)) {
            field.setAccessible(true);
            Object value = field.get(target);
            if (value == null || value.toString().isEmpty()) {
              throw new Exception();
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Join us in leading the innovations in decentralized finance WOO democratizes access to top-tier liquidity and exceptional trading execution while keeping costs competitive. We take pride in our two platforms WOO X, a pioneering crypto exchange dedicated to transparency and trustworthiness, and WOOFi, a top 15 DEX by 24-hour volume. Our native token, $WOO offers token holders a unique position to participate, engage, and maximize the benefits of both the DeFi and CeFi ecosystem. Our team of highly-selected 170 employees works from 12 cities across eight countries in Europe and Asia ğŸš€

Embrace our user-centric mission and vision Our vision is to inspire confidence, higher performance, and joy in every user. We have a mission to provide the best liquidity on the best terms. We compete not just on price execution but also on integrity, user experience, innovative tools, and global opportunities.

ï¼ˆäºŒï¼‰å„å²—ä½ JD

1 ã€QA Engineer

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Maintaining and improving the testing process to ensure the quality of the production system.

Gathering and analysing testing requirements, planning the testing process, and producing concrete testing plans and test cases.

Assisting with the API testing.

Being actively involved in requirements review, test case design, quality assurance, function launching, and issue tracking.

About you:

Background in finance/financial trading systems, such as FIX protocol, ordering process, derivatives trading, etc. will be a plus.

Experienced in testing Mobile apps and Web development is a plus.

Proficient in QA methodology with the ability to execute test cases and review results, reporting and documenting technical issues.

Capable to review and analyze system specifications.

Familiar with project management tools like Jira and Testlink.

Familiar with MySQL database.

Familiar with API testing and network traffic analysis tools or IP Tools.

Experience in automation testing using Python and JavaScript.

Enjoy breaking things and solving problems - not just being able to find out the â€˜whatâ€™, but also the â€˜whyâ€™.

Excellent troubleshooting, listening, and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, analytical mind, problem-solving aptitude, and strong organisational skills.

2 ã€Backend Java Engineer

3 ã€Flutter Mobile Engineer

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Implementation of product roadmap for iOS and Android application.

Build, deploy and test applications and release them to the Google Play Store.

Maintaining existing application for possible fixes & performance improvements.

Coordinating with the Cloud/Mobile/Embedded/Design teams in solving problems, creating ideas, and improving UX.

Writing readable & reusable code while fulfilling expected documentation standards & coverage.

Developing a "bullet-proof Software Development Kit" with the rest of the team for the different platforms.

About you:

More than 1 year of Flutter development experience.

Proficient in using various components of Flutter, such as: basic components, layout components, container components, scrollable components, functional components. Proficient in using Flutter's state management, global state management, and routing management.

Familiar with Flutter's gestures, animations, WebSockets, internationalization.

Familiar with Flutter's CustomPaint and Canvas.

Familiar with Flutter's package management, as well as the App Store and Play Store publishing process.

Solid understanding of Dart language.

Have own understanding of page rendering performance optimization under high frequency data refresh.

Experience with complete Flutter projects is preferred.

4 ã€Senior Frontend Engineer

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Developing WOO X web products that support digital asset trading. Participating in building up innovative tools to enrich the ecosystem of our products. Optimising the process of development, performance and user experience continuously. Why work with us:

Join us in realising our vision in advancing decentralisation, and leading innovation in CeFi and DeFi. Enjoy work flexibility, a supportive team, and an environment that nurtures your ideas. Plus, expect a performance-based annual bonus for all contributors at WOO ğŸ’ª

About you:

Minimum of 3 years of frontend development experience and familiarity with React.js. Proficient in JavaScript, CSS, HTML and ES6. Familiar with real-time data processing methods, such as Websocket and RxJs, and able to detect potential performance issues. Knowledge of blockchain/crypto service or expertise in the online blockchain/crypto industry is a BIG plus. You enjoy breaking things and solving problems - not just being able to find out the 'what', but also the 'why'. Excellent troubleshooting, listening and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines. Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

5 ã€Senior DevOps Engineer

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Monitoring our exchange service status, refining the deployment pipeline, monitoring, troubleshooting and identifying the root cause of issues. Focusing on ensuring the stability of the service and helping the Engineering team to deploy features to production. Handling and solving issues when service goes wrong. Designing a better deployment pipeline. Building tools to monitor systems and identify issues. Why work with us:

Join us in realising our vision in advancing decentralisation, and leading innovation in CeFi and DeFi. Enjoy work flexibility, a supportive team, and an environment that nurtures your ideas. Plus, expect a performance-based annual bonus for all contributors at WOO ğŸ’ª

About you:

(Must) Familiar with one of the IaC tools such as Terraform or Ansible.

(Must) Familiar with one of the cloud providers such as GCP, AWS or Azure.

(Must) Familiar with Kubernetes, Helm and Docker Familiar with one of GitOps such as ArgoCD.

Familiar with one of the monitoring systems such as Prometheus and Grafana.

Familiar with one of the logging systems Loki or ELK.

Familiar with one of MQ tools such as RocketMQ Familiar with one of the cache tools such as Redis.

Familiar with one of SQL/NoSQL databases such as MySQL or Mongo.

Familiar with one of the programming languages such as Python or Golang.

Nice to have! - Security-related experience.

24/7 on-call when there are urgent issues to handle and must be handled in a timely + a responsible manner. Knowledge of the blockchain/crypto domain or expertise in the online blockchain/crypto industry is a BIG plus. Excellent troubleshooting, listening and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

item.content:encoded:
æˆ‘æ—¥å¸¸ä½¿ç”¨ MacbookPro, ä½†æœ‰ä¸€åŠçš„å¼€å‘å·¥ä½œé€šè¿‡ SSH åœ¨ Linux/amd64 çš„ç¯å¢ƒä¸‹å®Œæˆ. è€ƒè™‘åˆ°æˆ‘åŸºæœ¬ä½¿ç”¨ vim åšä¸ºç¼–è¾‘å™¨, ä¸Šè¿°æ–¹æ¡ˆçš„å”¯ä¸€ç—›ç‚¹åœ¨äºä¸¤å°æœºå™¨æ— æ³•å…±äº«å‰ªè´´ç›˜.

æ˜¨å¤©ä¹˜ç€é…ç½®æ–°ç¯å¢ƒçš„æœºä¼š, æœç´¢äº†ä¸€ä¸‹è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆ, é€‰æ‹©äº† OSC 52.

OSC æ˜¯ Operating System Command çš„ç¼©å†™, å…¶çº¦å®šäº†ä¸€ç³»åˆ—ç‰¹æ®Šç¬¦å·çš„å«ä¹‰. OSC 52 æ˜¯å…¶ä¸€ä¸ªå­ç±», ç”¨äºæ§åˆ¶ç³»ç»Ÿå‰ªè´´æ¿. æˆ‘ä»¬å¼•ç”¨ tmux çš„æ–‡æ¡£æ¥æ€»ç»“å…¶åŸç†:

Some terminals offer an escape sequence to set the clipboard. This is one of the operating system control sequences so it is known as OSC 52.

The way it works is that when text is copied in tmux it is packaged up and sent to the outside terminal in a similar way to how tmux draws the text and colours and attributes. The outside terminal recognises the clipboard escape sequence and sets the system clipboard.

å½“å‰å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†çš„ç»ˆç«¯éƒ½å·²ç»æ”¯æŒäº†è¿™é¡¹åŠŸèƒ½, å½“ä½ åœ¨ç»ˆç«¯æ‰§è¡Œ echo -en "\e]52;c;$(base64 <<< OSC)\a" åå†é»è´´å¯ä»¥çœ‹åˆ° OSC è¿™ä¸‰ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦ä¸².

OSC 52 åœ¨ tmux ä¸­çš„å®šä¹‰æ˜¯ \033]52;%p1%s;%p2%s\a, å…¶ä¸­å„é¡¹çš„å«ä¹‰æ˜¯:

  • \033 æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå…«è¿›åˆ¶è¡¨ç¤ºçš„ 27, å¯¹åº”æ§åˆ¶ç¬¦å· ESC. æˆ‘ä»¬ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ \x1B(åå…­è¿›åˆ¶) æˆ– \e(ç®€å†™).
  • ]52 ä»£è¡¨ OSC 52
  • %p1%s æ˜¯ tmux çš„å ä½ç¬¦, å®é™…ä½¿ç”¨æ—¶ c ä»£è¡¨å‰ªè´´æ¿
  • %p2%s å¯¹åº” base64 åçš„å‰ªè´´å†…å®¹.
  • \a æ˜¯æ§åˆ¶å­—ç¬¦ BEL çš„ç¼©å†™, ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ \x7 æˆ– \07.

æˆ‘åœ¨ iterm2 ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨ tmux, å‚è€ƒ tmux çš„å®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£, å¯ä»¥çŸ¥é“å…³é”®çš„å‡ é¡¹è®¾ç½®:

  1. iterm2 éœ€è¦å…è®¸å†…éƒ¨åº”ç”¨è®¿é—®ç³»ç»Ÿå‰ªè´´æ¿, Link
  2. tmux é…ç½® TERM, æ£€æŸ¥æ–¹å¼ä¸º tmux info | grep Ms, è®¾ç½®æ–¹å¼ä¸º set-option -as terminal-overrides ",xterm-256color:clipboard"
  3. tmux é…ç½® set-clipboard, è®¾ç½®è®¿é—®æ˜¯ set -g set-clipboard on
  4. é€šè¿‡ tmux source-file æ›´æ–°é…ç½®

éœ€è¦é¢å¤–è°ˆçš„æ˜¯ set-clipboard, æ–‡æ¡£æ¨èçš„è®¾ç½®æ˜¯ external, ä½†æˆ‘é€‰æ‹©çš„æ˜¯ on. äºŒè€…çš„åŒºåˆ«åœ¨äº on å…è®¸ tmux å’Œ tmux å†…çš„åº”ç”¨è®¾ç½®å‰ªè´´æ¿, external ä»…å…è®¸ tmux è®¾ç½®å‰ªè´´æ¿. æ‰€ä»¥å½“æˆ‘é€šè¿‡ ssh è®¿é—®å¼€å‘æœºå¹¶å¸Œæœ›åœ¨å¼€å‘æœºå†…è®¿é—®æœ¬æœºçš„å‰ªè´´æ¿æ—¶éœ€è¦å°† set-clipboard è®¾ç½®ä¸º on.

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] DevOps [è¿œç¨‹] [20-25K] work life balance å¤–ä¼
item.content:encoded:
å…¬å¸ï¼šXometry

æ–°å¢ä¸€ä¸ª DevOps å²—ä½ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è¿œç¨‹ï¼Œwork life balance

è‹±è¯­é¢è¯•(ç®€å•æ²Ÿé€šå³å¯)ï¼Œè‹±æ–‡ç®€å†

ç›®å‰ä¸­å›½å›¢é˜Ÿæ²¡æœ‰è¿ç»´ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥éœ€è¦é‡åˆ°äº›è¿ç»´é—®é¢˜éœ€è¦ä¸€ä¸ª DevOps Engineer æ¥è§£å†³ï¼Œåˆæ­¥çœ‹ä¸‹æ¥ä¸ä¼šæœ‰å¤ªèŠ±é‡Œèƒ¡å“¨çš„æ“ä½œ.

åŠ  V å†…æ¨ï¼šAce151314

ä»¥å‰åŠ è¿‡æˆ‘çš„æœ‰éœ€è¦å† V æˆ‘ä¸€ä¸‹


å…·ä½“è¦æ±‚å¦‚ä¸‹:

The platform

Our in-house platform is built on Ruby on Rails stack with PostgreSQL database. We are building the uber-like platform for manufacturing, deploying updates almost every working day, so there is a lot of interesting work to be done. Xometryâ€™s platform and corporate functions utilize multiple cloud service providers. The ideal candidate would be well versed in cloud technologies, including IaaS,PaaS, SaaS, hybrid, and multi-cloud.

Successful candidate has

â— 3+ years of experience as DevOps&IT support engineer.

â— Basic Linux infrastructure skills: ability to connect to a server via ssh, view vital metrics and logs on the
server, edit configuration files and restart related system-based services and docker containers if necessary.

â— Basic skills in working with cloud providers (AWS, GCE, Azure, Tencent, etc.) will be a big plus.

â— Ability to work with git: read file change history, edit text files with ACLs managed via GitOps, make a pull-request with proposed changes.

â— Basic knowledge of Chinese IT law specifications: things like ICP licenses, or at least the ability and willingness to study related official documents.

â— Chinese language skills to communicate with the team on site (for non-Chinese candidates).

â— Proficiency in English for communication with EU and US based IT teams.

â— Experience installing and customizing MacOS

â— Ability to diagnose a problem remotely.

â— Experience with MS Azure and Google for Business will be a plus.

â— Willingness to document your work. (Writing instructions for the team or users)
Work conditions

â— English and Chinese speaking tech team in the Chinese branch of a large international company.

â— A developing startup (65 people in China) inside the world market leader (~1000 people in total).

â— Full-time position.

â— Salary is negotiable with each candidate.

item.title: [iDev] spotlight with Core Data åˆ°åº•å¥½ä¸å¥½ä½¿ï¼Ÿ
item.content:encoded:
åšäº†ä¸€ä¸ªè®°å½•çš„ app ï¼Œç”¨çš„ Core Data ï¼Œä¸Šä¸ªç‰ˆæœ¬æ·»åŠ äº† spotlight, ä»£ç å¾ˆç®€å•

        self.spotlightDelegate = StorageSpotlightDelegate(forStoreWith: description, coordinator: container.persistentStoreCoordinator)
        let isSpotlightDisable = UserDefaults.standard.bool(forKey: "isSpotlightDisable")
        if !isSpotlightDisable {
            self.toggleSpotlightIndexing(enable: true)
        }

//MARK: - Spotlight
extension CoreDataStack {
    public func toggleSpotlightIndexing(enable: Bool) {
        guard let spotlightDelegate = spotlightDelegate else { return }
        
        if enable {
            spotlightDelegate.startSpotlightIndexing()
        } else {
            spotlightDelegate.stopSpotlightIndexing()
            spotlightDelegate.deleteSpotlightIndex { error in
                if let error = error {
                    print(error)
                }
            }
        }
        
        UserDefaults.standard.set(!enable, forKey: "isSpotlightDisable")

withAuthModel.init = () => {

  const { accessToken } = lsGetToken({ bellwether: true }) ?? {};

const withAuth = (Component) => {
  const Auth = (props) => {
    const loading = useModel(withAuthModel, 'loading');
    const location = useLocation();

    useEffect(() => {
      (async function() {
        await withAuthModel.init();
      })();
    }, [location.pathname]);

    if (loading) {
      return <Loading />;
    }

    return (
      <Component {...props} />
    ); 
  };

  return Auth;
};

const WithAuthConsoleLayout = withAuth(() => {
  return <ConsoleLayout />;

item.title: [è¿œç¨‹å·¥ä½œ] è¿œç¨‹å…¼èŒ Android AI å·¥å…·ç±» App UX/UI è®¾è®¡
item.content:encoded:
Android AI å·¥å…·ç±»åº”ç”¨ï¼Œéœ€è¦ä¸€å UX/UI è®¾è®¡ï¼Œäº¤äº’å·²ç»æœ‰åŸºæœ¬çš„å‚è€ƒè®¾è®¡ï¼Œéœ€è¦å®Œå–„ã€‚ æ´»ä¸éš¾ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¸Œæœ›æ²Ÿé€šèƒ½åŠ›ï¼Œå›¢é˜Ÿåä½œèƒ½åŠ›è¿˜ä¸é”™çš„å°ä¼™ä¼´åŠ å…¥ã€‚è‹±æ–‡çœ‹å¾—æ‡‚ç®€å•çš„å°±è¡Œã€‚

å…·ä½“è¦æ±‚å¦‚ä¸‹, æ„Ÿå…´è¶£çš„å¯ä»¥æŠŠç®€å†å’Œä»¥å¾€ä½œå“ä»‹ç»å‘æˆ‘ email: eepaul@qq.com

-----

Job Title: Part-Time Android UX/UI Designer

Location: Remote

About the Role:

We are looking for a talented, part-time Android UX/UI Designer to join our team. This role is ideal for a creative designer passionate about crafting user-friendly and visually engaging mobile experiences. Youâ€™ll be contributing to an exciting AI-related productivity tool app, enhancing user efficiency and experience. We already have a rough reference design in place, which will serve as a foundation for further development and refinement.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and prototype user interfaces and user experiences for an Android productivity tool app.
  • Collaborate with the product team to turn requirements into engaging user-friendly designs.
  • Use Figma to create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes that align with the Material3 design system.
  • Build upon an existing rough reference design, iterating to optimize and refine user experience.
  • Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and make data-informed design adjustments.
  • Communicate effectively with developers to ensure design fidelity and quality throughout the project lifecycle.

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 1 year of experience in UX/UI design, with a focus on Android applications.
  • Proficiency in Figma and familiarity with the Material3 design system.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively within a team.
  • Available to work at least 30 hours per week.

Compensation and Payment:

  • Hourly rate: 75 RMB to 125 RMB per hour, depending on experience and skill level.
  • This position is paid weekly.
  • The designer will submit a timesheet every weekend, and payment will be processed based on the submitted hours.

What We Offer:

  • Flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely.
  • A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
  • The chance to contribute to an innovative AI-driven productivity project and grow your design skills.

Please forward to friends who need this.
( https://imgur.com/a/t0vpwAy)
We are a tech company located in Silicon Valley, USA, co-founded by senior experts from Palo Alto (home to international companies like Apple, Google, Facebook, Logitech, Tesla, PayPal as well as Stanford University) and other top experts from various countries.

This project, which is at the forefront of AI model development, represents a major leap forward in the virtual world.
This project will make the multiverse a reality, let us write history together.
The project has authorized patents (international) in AGI, and the team has over 30 years of game development experience (mainly overseas games, English-Speaking).
1 Product Partner, should be a product manager capable of building from zero to one (preferably with AI project experience or game project experience)
2 Technical Co-founders or Entrepreneur (specializing in AI, full-stack development, and various other technical directions)
3 Art Director/Creative Partner or Entrepreneur (since design is crucial in many areas - imagine we're designing something like an iPhone)
4 Gaming Partner or Entrepreneur (gaming is an important direction for us; we're developing new AI models with patents granted in both China and US, which can be applied to gaming and other fields, with potential to sell to leading AI companies and gaming companies, etc.)

In general, we welcome all kinds of high-level talents /::D

SEND YOUR RESUME TO INFO@MARV.EE

[æ¸¸æˆ] Free Incredibox Mustard Online | Drag and drop to create your own beats!
item.content:encoded:
Incredibox Mustard is a fan-made version of the popular music creation game, Incredibox. It allows players to engage in a fun and interactive music-making experience by combining various animated characters, each representing different sounds and musical elements. Overall, Incredibox Mustard offers an engaging platform for music creation that combines creativity with fun visuals, making it a favorite among both casual gamers and music enthusiasts.

Try it and you will love it: https://incrediboxmustard.fun/

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] ç§‘æŠ€å¤§å‚æ‹›è˜èµ„æ·±å¤§æ•°æ®è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¶æ„å¸ˆï¼ˆbase æ–°åŠ å¡)å¤§æ•°æ®æ¶æ„æŠ€æœ¯èƒŒæ™¯ï¼Œä¸­è‹±æ–‡æµåˆ©
item.content:encoded:
Senior Big Data Solution Architect
Responsibilities:
The candidate needs to deeply understand customers' needs and pain points regarding Big Data products and solutions and design overall Big Data product solutions tailored to customer business scenarios and technical requirements.
Capable of recommending the core advantages and capabilities of Big Data products and solutions to customers, overcoming obstacles to migrating customer data to the cloud, supporting the implementation of Big Data product solutions in the cloud, and solidifying Big Data product solutions.
Thoroughly understand customers' technical issues and requirements regarding Big Data products, act as a bridge within the Big Data product team, and collaborate efficiently with industry, research and development, pre-sales, and after-sales teams to effectively solve customer problems.
Extract core customer requirements for Big Data products and drive continuous optimization and enhancement of product capabilities.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree or above in computer science, communication, or related fields, with over five years of experience in Big Data projects. Experience in cloud computing and Big Data development is preferred.
Familiar with the open-source Hadoop ecosystem, knowledgeable about various Big Data component architectures (including Spark, Flink, Elasticsearch, etc.), and familiar with the characteristics and issues of these components in various Big Data scenarios.
Familiar with the characteristics of mainstream cloud computing Big Data products, especially AWS, Azure, and GCP's Big Data products. Experience as a cloud vendor Big Data architect is preferred.
Strong communication skills, clear, logical thinking, proactive and responsible work attitude, positive and open-minded approach to work, and good teamwork abilities.
Proficient in Chinese and English, with English proficiency for daily customer communication and support.

ä»¥ä¸Šè¡¨æ•°æ®é‡åªæœ‰ 1~5w ã€‚

1 ã€SQL1

SELECT 1
FROM company_software AS company_software
WHERE company_software.author_id  = 1
  and company_software.country  in ('china', 'korea', 'england')
  and company_software.software_id    = '1'

å¹¶ä¸ä¼šå¯¼è‡´æ…¢æŸ¥è¯¢

2 ã€SQL2

SELECT software_id
FROM sortware
WHERE author_id  = 1
  and NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1
                  FROM company_software AS company_software
                  WHERE company_software.author_id = 1
                    and company_software.country in ('china', 'korea', 'england')
                    and CONVERT(sortware.software_id , char) = company_software.software_id)
LIMIT 0, 100

item.content:encoded:
select
  DATE_FORMAT(`date`, "%Y-%m-%d") as time,
  thealth_level as "å¥åº·åº¦",
  COUNT(DISTINCT(tserver_name)) as "æ€»æ•°"
from
  (
    select
      date,
	  server_name as tserver_name,
      MIN(health_level) as thealth_level
    FROM
      cpu_throttled_health
    WHERE
      date > DATE_FORMAT(CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 7 DAY, "%Y-%m-%d")
    GROUP BY
      date,
	  server_name
  ) as tt
group by
  tt.thealth_level,
  tt.date

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] RSS3 is looking for a DevOps Engineer
item.content:encoded:
About RSS3

RSS3 is the Open Information Layerâ€“an Environment for (truly) Open AI, Open Search, and Open Social. We build for Open Information and the Open Web.

We advocate for the power of freedom of information and emphasize its openness, accessibility and universal availability. Unlike major platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok that control vast amounts of public information, we urge individuals to redirect the power of data giants toward the public good by supporting decentralized channels and networks, and envision a world where open information empowers everyone.

RSS3 was launched by Natural Selection Labs and is backed by top investors including Arweave, Coinbase, Coinshares, Dapper Labs, Dragonfly, Fabric Ventures and Hashkey.

Homepage: https://rss3.io

GitHubï¼š https://github.com/NaturalSelectionLabs/RSS3

Twitterï¼š https://twitter.com/rss3_

Natural Selection Labs

We are a globally distributed organization: all of our members come from different countries, including US, Canada, UK, China, Singapore, New Zealand, and Philippines.

Our team is equal, open, and free. We advocate flexible working hours, so both early birds and night owls are welcome!

All our work is open source: https://github.com/RSS3-network.

Since our establishment, we have made significant progress and are incredibly proud of our team culture and atmosphere.

DevOps Engineer

RSS3 is looking for a DevOps Engineer. You will be collaborating with our Europe and/or North America R&D team on feature delivery and SRE duties.

Responsibilities:

  1. Collaborate with different internal teams to optimize existing deployment strategies
  2. Support and improve infrastructure/service availability and observability
  3. R&D for all components of the RSS3 Network

Requirements:

  1. Self-motivated and able to communicate and collaborate with other engineers
  2. Proficiency in Golang/Python/JavaScript or other languages
  3. Proficiency with K8s
  4. Proficiency with AWS/GCP
  5. Proficiency with Terraform/Helm
  6. Base in Non-Asian time zones

Nice to have:

  1. Web3 knowledge and/or experience
  2. Experience with Golang/Python/JavaScript development
  3. Experience with PostgreSQL/AlloyDB/ElasticSearch/Redis/Kafka
  4. Basic proficiency in Mandarin

We Use:

  • GitHub

  • Notion

  • Slack

  • Join the VS Code Gang or the JetBrains Squad

We offer:

  • A chance to directly participate in the Internet evolution and make the world a better place.
  • Opportunities to collaborate with the worldâ€™s top Open Web projects.
  • A team of loving and competent companions!
  • FULLY-REMOTE role with very flexible working hours.
  • An AWESOME & CARING company culture.
  • Competitive allowances and benefits.
  • We are committed to diversity and welcome talented applicants from all walks of life to apply! All applicants will be considered regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, nationality, veteran or disability status.

Contact

We look forward to receiving your CV:

talent@rss3.io

item.title: [Vue.js] element-plus el-select-v2 ç»„ä»¶ filter-method æ–¹æ³•ç»™ option èµ‹å€¼æŠ¥é”™
item.content:encoded:
html éƒ¨åˆ†æ˜¯è¿™æ ·çš„

<div v-if="item.type=='multi-select'">
    <el-select-v2 
        ref="selectMultiRef"
        class="bar"
        v-model="selectedValues[item.value]"
        filterable
        placeholder="Select"
        clearable
        highlight-current-row
        :options="filteredOptions(item).value"
        @change="updateOptions"
        :filter-method="filterMethod"
        multiple
        >
    </el-select-v2>
</div>

filterMethod å…·ä½“æ˜¯

const filterMethod = (query:any) => {
    let options = selectMultiRef.value[0].allOptions
    const escapeStringRegexp = (string = '') => string.replace(/[|\\{}()[\]^$+*?.]/g, '\\$&').replace(/-/g, '\\x2d')

    const regexp = new RegExp(escapeStringRegexp(query), 'i')
    let filteredOptions = options.filter((opt: any) => {
        return query ? regexp.test(opt.label || '') : true
    }).sort((a: any, b: any) => {
        const aStartsWith = a.label.toLowerCase().startsWith(query.toLowerCase());
        const bStartsWith = b.label.toLowerCase().startsWith(query.toLowerCase());
        return (aStartsWith === bStartsWith) ? 0 : (aStartsWith ? -1 : 1);
    })

    selectMultiRef.value[0].options = filteredOptions //è¿™è¡ŒæŠ¥é”™
};

æŠ¥é”™ä¿¡æ¯ï¼šTypeError: 'set' on proxy: trap returned falsish for property 'options'

è¿™æ˜¯ V2EX ä»å¾ˆä¹…ä»¥å‰çš„ä¸€é“é¢è¯•é¢˜æˆ‘ç›´æ¥æ‹¿æ¥ç»ƒæ‰‹çš„ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æˆ‘å¹¶ä¸ç†è§£æ­»é”å‡ºç°å’Œä¸å‡ºç°çš„åŸå› 

ä½¿ç”¨ä¸¤ä¸ª goroutine äº¤æ›¿æ‰“å°åºåˆ—ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ª goroutinue æ‰“å°æ•°å­—ï¼Œ å¦å¤–ä¸€ä¸ª goroutine æ‰“å°å­—æ¯ï¼Œ æœ€ç»ˆæ•ˆæœå¦‚ä¸‹ 12AB34CD56EF78GH910IJ ã€‚

ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸€ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªä»£ç æ˜¯èƒ½æ­£å¸¸è¿è¡Œçš„ï¼Œä½†ç»“å°¾è¦é€šè¿‡ sleep æ¥é˜»å¡


	ch1 := make(chan bool)
	ch2 := make(chan bool)

	go func() {
		// for loop to print 2 to 10, increase by 2
		for i := 2; i <= 10; i += 2 {
			<-ch1
			fmt.Print(i - 1)
			fmt.Print(i)
			ch2 <- true
		}
		close(ch2)
	}()

	go func() {
		str := "abcdefghij"
		// for loop to print a to j
		for i := 1; i < len(str); i += 2 {
			<-ch2
			fmt.Print(str[i-1 : i+1])
			ch1 <- true
		}
		close(ch1)
	}()

	ch1 <- true
	time.Sleep(10 * time.Second)

ç‰ˆæœ¬äºŒï¼Œé€šè¿‡ done channel ï¼Œä½†è¿™ä¸ªç‰ˆæœ¬å°±ä¼šå‡ºç°æ­»é”

	ch1 := make(chan bool)
	ch2 := make(chan bool)
	done := make(chan bool) // æ–°å¢ done 

	go func() {
		// for loop to print 2 to 10, increase by 2
		for i := 2; i <= 10; i += 2 {
			<-ch1
			fmt.Print(i - 1)
			fmt.Print(i)
			ch2 <- true
		}
		close(ch2)
	}()

	go func() {
		str := "abcdefghij"
		// for loop to print a to j
		for i := 1; i < len(str); i += 2 {
			<-ch2
			fmt.Print(str[i-1 : i+1])
			ch1 <- true
		}
		done <- true // é€šçŸ¥å®Œæˆ
		close(ch1) // ch1 å…³ä¸å…³é—­éƒ½ä¼šæ­»é”
	}()

	ch1 <- true
	<-done // ç­‰å¾…å®Œæˆé€šçŸ¥

ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸‰ï¼ŒåŸºäºäºŒè°ƒæ•´ï¼Œä¸æ­»é”


	ch1 := make(chan bool, 1) // å’Œç‰ˆæœ¬äºŒçš„æ ¸å¿ƒåŒºåˆ«
	ch2 := make(chan bool)
	done := make(chan bool)

	go func() {
		// for loop to print 2 to 10, increase by 2
		for i := 2; i <= 10; i += 2 {
			<-ch1
			fmt.Print(i - 1)
			fmt.Print(i)
			ch2 <- true
		}
		close(ch2)
	}()

	go func() {
		str := "abcdefghij"
		// for loop to print a to j
		for i := 1; i < len(str); i += 2 {
			<-ch2
			fmt.Print(str[i-1 : i+1])
			ch1 <- true
		}
		done <- true
		close(ch1)
	}()
